MIAMExemptionsChecklist: Previous MIAM attendance or previous MIAM exemption
benefitPaymentChecklist: For a stepchild or step children
In addition to child support or maintenance already paid under a Child Support Agency assessment
To meet expenses incurred by a child in relation to being educated or training for work
When either the child or the person with care of the child or the absent parent of the child is not habitually resident in the United Kingdom
case_data.MIAMOtherGroundsChecklist: The applicant is bankrupt evidenced by a bankruptcy order in respect of the prospective applicant.
MIAMUrgencyReasonChecklist: There is risk to the life, liberty or physical safety of the prospective applicant or his or her family or his or her home
Any delay caused by MIAM would cause significant risk of a miscarriage of justice
Any delay caused by MIAM would cause unreasonable hardship to the prospective applicant
Any delay caused by MIAM would cause irretrievable problems in dealing with the dispute (including the irretrievable loss of significant evidence)

There is a significant risk that in the period necessary to schedule and attend a MIAM, proceedings relating to the dispute will be brought in another state in which a valid claim to jurisdiction may exist, such that a court in that ... cont
potentialAllegationChecklist: Assets are / were held through the medium of trusts / settlements/ family/ unquoted corporate entities or otherwise held offshore or overseas
The value of family assets, trust and/or corporate entities
Expert accountancy evidence will be required
There are substantial arguments concerning the illiquidity of assets
There may be substantial arguments about which assets are “matrimonial assets” or “non-matrimonial assets”
There may be substantial arguments about the parties’ respective contributions
There are/may be disputed allegations of “obvious and gross” conduct
The case involves an application under Schedule 1 Children Act 1989
The application involves a complex or novel legal argument
There is likely to be a need for the involvement of Intervenors
The case involves an insolvency issue

A domestic violence protection notice issued under section 24 of the Crime and Security Act 2010 against a prospective party;
A relevant protective injunction;

case_data.MIAMPreviousAttendanceChecklist: In the 4 months prior to making the application, the person filed a relevant family application confirming that a MIAM exemption applied and that application related to the same or substantially the same dispute
